Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の人
Entry.EnglishText: Man

Entry.JapaneseText: 祭司
Entry.EnglishText: Priest

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード・蒼の聖殿
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd - Azure Sanctuary

Entry.JapaneseText: 蒼の聖殿
Entry.EnglishText: Azure Sanctuary

Entry.JapaneseText: さあ、これからどうする？
Entry.EnglishText: Okay, where do we go now?

Entry.JapaneseText: 「自分が何者かを知れ。 道は汝の中にある」 ……どういう事？ 私はどうすればいいのよ？
Entry.EnglishText: "Become aware of what you are. The path lies within yourself." ...Just what does that mean? What am I supposed to do?

Entry.JapaneseText: 「自分が何者かを知れ」か…… まるで<Hilda>が自分が何者かを 知らないような言い方だな……
Entry.EnglishText: "Become aware of what you are." Hm... It's almost as though they're saying that you don't know who you are.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……そうね。 ……私は知らないわ、 自分が何者か……
Entry.EnglishText: ...That's true. I really don't know who I am.

Entry.JapaneseText: 幼い頃に捨てられ、 トーマに拾われた…… 親の顔すら覚えてない。
Entry.EnglishText: I was abandoned at a young age, and then taken in by Tohma... I don't even remember my parent's faces.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……聖獣が<Hilda>さんの 生まれの事を言ってるなら、 ご両親を探してみたらどうですか？
Entry.EnglishText: If the Sacred Beast is talking about the circumstances of your birth, then perhaps we should go and search for your parents?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……会いたくもないわ……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't want to see them.

Entry.JapaneseText: 子供を捨てるような親なんか…… こんな身体に生んだ親なんかに……
Entry.EnglishText: They abandoned their own child... They brought someone like me into this world...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……そう言えば、オックスさんが ハーフのたくさん住んでいた場所の 話をしてましたよね？
Entry.EnglishText: That reminds me though, Ochs mentioned something about a place where many Halfs reside, didn't he?

Entry.JapaneseText: 東大陸の北方と 言っていたな……
Entry.EnglishText: I believe he said it was located in the northern part of the eastern continent.

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、もしかしたらフランツさんなら、 何か知ってるかもしれないヨ！
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, maybe Frantz would know something about it!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……私は何も知りたくない。 親なんかに会いたくない……
Entry.EnglishText: ...I'm fine with not knowing. I don't want to meet my parents.

Entry.JapaneseText: それがおまえに与えられた 聖獣の試練だとしてもか？
Entry.EnglishText: Even if meeting them is the trial that the Sacred Beast has given you?

Entry.JapaneseText: とにかく行ってみようヨ！ ね！
Entry.EnglishText: Come on, it can't hurt to at least head on over there!

Entry.JapaneseText: くそっ、こいつめ…… 俺の攻撃が効いてないのか……？
Entry.EnglishText: Damn, this thing is tough... Are my attacks ineffective against it...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 腹だ！ 腹を狙え！
Entry.EnglishText: The stomach! Aim for its stomach!

Entry.JapaneseText: 腹？
Entry.EnglishText: Its stomach?

Entry.JapaneseText: そいつの弱点は、 腹の辺りにあるんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, its weak point is near its belly!

Entry.JapaneseText: やった……!!
Entry.EnglishText: You got him!

Entry.JapaneseText: 聖殿にあんな化け物を放置しておく 不届きなヒューマなど、 蒼獣様が救ってくださろうか。
Entry.EnglishText: Would the Azure Beast even grant salvation to you insolent Huma who would leave such a monster within the temple?

Entry.JapaneseText: 何を!? 満足に蒼獣様の教えを 理解できない者に、 蒼獣様の御前にいる資格はない！
Entry.EnglishText: Excuse me? Those who cannot fully understand the Azure Beast's teachings are unfit to even stand in his presence!

Entry.JapaneseText: もうやめよ……！
Entry.EnglishText: That's enough!

Entry.JapaneseText: 私はガジュマとヒューマを分ければ、 争いは収まると思っていた。
Entry.EnglishText: I had thought that if Huma and Gajuma were separated, the fighting would stop.

Entry.JapaneseText: しかし、それでは何の解決にも なっていなかった……
Entry.EnglishText: However, now I see that didn't resolve anything.

Entry.JapaneseText: そもそも蒼獣様は種族の別なく、 信じる者すべてを 救ってくださるはずなのだ。
Entry.EnglishText: The Azure Beast, without regards to race, will grant salvation to all who truly believe!

Entry.JapaneseText: 我々はまっすぐ、 向き合わなければならない。 互いを理解し、手を取り合うべきなのだ。
Entry.EnglishText: We must face this head on. Only when we come to understand each other shall we be able to join hands.

Entry.JapaneseText: そんな事できるものか！
Entry.EnglishText: As if something like that is doable!

Entry.JapaneseText: 当たり前だ！ 祭司様を 殺そうとした奴なんかと 手を取り合うなんて……
Entry.EnglishText: Of course it's not! How can I be expected to join hands with the ones who tried to kill the Priest?!

Entry.JapaneseText: できる！ 現に今、おまえたちは協力して バイラスを倒したではないか！
Entry.EnglishText: It is possible! Were you not just working together to defeat that Birus?

Entry.JapaneseText: それぞれ違う部分を持ってはいるが、 私たちはわかりあえる。 必ず、わかりあえる！
Entry.EnglishText: Of course we have our differences, but we can come to understand one another. Of that, I am sure!

Entry.JapaneseText: なぜなら、私たちは同じ <Yellow>ヒト<White>だからだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Are we not all of one <Yellow>Mankind<White>?

Entry.JapaneseText: そうだ……バイラスは、 ヒューマやガジュマを 区別しない。
Entry.EnglishText: That's right. A Birus doesn't care if you're a Huma or a Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……奴らから見れば、 オレたちはみんな、 同じ<Yellow>ヒト<White>でしかない……
Entry.EnglishText: From their point of view, we're all just <Yellow>Humans<White>...

Entry.JapaneseText: 目で見るなよ、感じてくれよ。 ハートってヤツでな！
Entry.EnglishText: Don't use your eyes to see, use your heart to feel!

Entry.JapaneseText: でもよぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: Even then...

Entry.JapaneseText: あっ、バイラスだ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Oh no, a Birus!

Entry.JapaneseText: なんてネ！ どう、おどろいた!?
Entry.EnglishText: ...Just kidding! Well, did I scare you?

Entry.JapaneseText: コラッ!! このイタズラ小僧!!
Entry.EnglishText: Not funny, you little brat!

Entry.JapaneseText: コラッ!! このイタズラ小僧!!
Entry.EnglishText: Not funny, you little brat!

Entry.JapaneseText: ははっ、同じコト言ってる!!
Entry.EnglishText: Heehee, you even said the same thing!

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律か……
Entry.EnglishText: Right, the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか……戒律のせいで しゃべれないんだったネ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh right... She can't talk to me because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、男とは 話せないようだな……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems that she can't talk to men because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律……ですね。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh...the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか、戒律が あったんだったな……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh right, those commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、女と 話せないんだったわね……
Entry.EnglishText: He isn't allowed to talk to women because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: おお……なんという事だ…… これは、蒼獣様の怒りか？
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-What in the great sky...? Is the Lord Beast angry?

Entry.JapaneseText: 蒼獣様のご加護を授かっている この街でも種族間の問題が 噴出してきています。
Entry.EnglishText: Even in this city, which the Lord Beast has blessed, interracial tension has begun to occur.

Entry.JapaneseText: 蒼獣様の力が 弱まっているのでしょうか？
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder if His power has weakened...?

Entry.JapaneseText: リフトを動かしてくれないか。
Entry.EnglishText: Can the lift go back into operation?

Entry.JapaneseText: それはできかねる。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm afraid not.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマたちは私を脅して、 祭司の座を明け渡せと 要求してきた。
Entry.EnglishText: Some Gajuma threatened me, demanding that I hand the priesthood over to them.

Entry.JapaneseText: 街のヒューマたちが 守ってくれなければ、 私は殺されていたかもしれない。
Entry.EnglishText: Were it not for the protection of this city's Huma, they perhaps would have killed me.

Entry.JapaneseText: 関係ないガジュマまで 追い出す事はないはずだ。
Entry.EnglishText: But why did you drive out the Gajuma who had nothing to do with that?

Entry.JapaneseText: この騒ぎを治めるには、 もうこの方法しかないのだ…… ガジュマとヒューマを分けるしか……
Entry.EnglishText: There was no other way to resolve that uproar. There's no way around it, Huma and Gajuma need to be separated...

Entry.JapaneseText: 祭司……！
Entry.EnglishText: Priest!

Entry.JapaneseText: お、おまえ…… どうやって……
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-What? How did you get here?

Entry.JapaneseText: 登山洞を上がってきたんだよ！
Entry.EnglishText: I went up the Climbers' Cavern!

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたがおとなしく 祭司の座を渡してくれれば、 こんな事をせずに済んだのに……
Entry.EnglishText: If you had just done as we had asked and transferred the priesthood to us, then it would not have come to this...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……死んでもらうぜ、祭司！
Entry.EnglishText: It's time to die, priest!

Entry.JapaneseText: ま、待てよ……！
Entry.EnglishText: H-Hold on a second!

Entry.JapaneseText: よそ者はひっこんでろ！
Entry.EnglishText: You need to stay out of this!

Entry.JapaneseText: ひえーっ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Uwaaah!

Entry.JapaneseText: 逃がすか！
Entry.EnglishText: You're not getting away from me!

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、あの中って バイラスが……
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, aren't there Biruses in there...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ……急ごう。
Entry.EnglishText: Yes... Let's hurry.

Entry.JapaneseText: 色々とお騒がせしましたが、 なんとかこの街も落ち着きそうです。
Entry.EnglishText: We've been through a lot of trouble, but it seems that things have finally settled down.

Entry.JapaneseText: しかし、他の地域では 種族の問題が この街以上に深刻だとか。
Entry.EnglishText: However, I've heard that racial issues are more dire in other towns.

Entry.JapaneseText: お気をつけください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please take care.

Entry.JapaneseText: 再びバイラスが出てこないよう、 ガジュマとヒューマ、手を取り合って、 聖殿の修理をするになりました。
Entry.EnglishText: In order to keep the Biruses away, both Gajuma and Huma have started working together to repair the sanctuary.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ああ…… 罪深きガジュマたちを お許しください……
Entry.EnglishText: Ahh... Please forgive those sinful Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ここは蒼の聖殿。 蒼獣様を祀るために建てられ、 幾星霜の時を経て今日にあります。
Entry.EnglishText: This is the Azure Sanctuary. Built to enshrine the Azure Beast, this sanctuary has stood here for ages.

Entry.JapaneseText: 古くは多くの信仰を集めていましたが、 今はこの街以外で 蒼獣様を崇拝する者は ほとんどいなくなりました。
Entry.EnglishText: It used to attract scores of believers in the past, but nowadays, there are hardly any worshippers of the Azure Beast outside of this city.

Entry.JapaneseText: 残念な事です。
Entry.EnglishText: It's regrettable.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『蒼い球』 蒼獣信仰において、 この蒼い球は蒼獣の象徴となり、 信仰者たちの崇敬を集めている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Azure Globe - This azure globe is considered a symbol of the Azure Beast by adherents of the faith. Devout followers revere this globe.
Entry.Notes: double check with the other translation for this

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『聖殿の柱』 蒼獣をかたどった柱。 同じような柱がバビログラードの 街中にもいくつか立っている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Sanctuary's Bridge - A bridge symbolizing the Azure Beast. Similar bridges are built all over Babilograd.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ノート』 子供が書いたノート。 下手な文字で、 何が書かれているか読み取れない。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Note - A note written by a child. Its messy handwriting makes it hard to read.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『蒼獣外典』 蒼獣信仰による 絶対的世界の創造について 書かれた本。 あまりにも過激な内容のため、 発行禁止になった。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Azure Beast Apocrypha - This book is about the creation of an absolute world according to the Azure Beast's faith. It was banned from publication because of its radical content.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『燭台』 宵闇を照らしたりするのはもちろん、 儀式の時に火を灯すなどする時に 調法な品。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Candlestick - These candles are lit not only when night falls, but also during rituals.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『蒼獣信仰研究』 『海と空の見える都市』 『信仰の礎・うるわしの聖殿』 祭司がカレギア中に 蒼獣信仰を広めるため、著したもの。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Research About the Azure Beast's Faith - "Cities with a View of the Sea and Sky" "The Cornerstone of Faith: The Beautiful Sanctuary" Books written by the priest in order to propagate the faith throughout Callegea.
